TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit AudioSession extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Interface to to control the audio context of your application

remarks.para: Both the and reference the same underlying singleton object. Properties in were deprecated in iOS 7.0, and appears to be the preferred path forward.

You use the various AudioSession methods to control how the input and output are handled by the operating system, configure the recorder and speakers, control where the audio is played to, and where the audio is recorded from. AudioSession also provides a mechanism to start and stop using the audio system and to monitor changes to the audio system.
Both the initialization sequence and the use of some properties on AudioSession can throw an .
Your application can use the method with the AudioInputAvailable value to monitor when the microphone becomes available.

MemberSignature.Value: public static AudioToolbox.AudioSessionErrors AddListener (AudioToolbox.AudioSessionProperty property, AudioToolbox.AudioSession.PropertyListener listener);

.method public static hidebysig valuetype AudioToolbox.AudioSessionErrors AddListener(valuetype AudioToolbox.AudioSessionProperty property, class AudioToolbox.AudioSession/PropertyListener listener) cil managed

Docs.summary: Developers should not use this deprecated method.
Determines whether audio input is available.

remarks.para: This property determines whether input is available. Phones always have input available, while iPod Touch devices only have input available if a microphone or a headset with a microphone is plugged.
If there is an error reading or setting the property, this will raise an .

Docs.summary: To be added.
Obsolete method.

remarks.para: If there is an error reading or setting the property, this will raise an .

Docs.summary: Event raised when the input and output audio routes change on the device.

remarks.para: This event is raised when audio hardware is plugged or unplugged from your device. The event receives a instance that contains information about the reason for the change and both the old input sources and output targets as well as the new ones.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool AudioShouldDuck { get; set; }
member this.AudioShouldDuck : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Controls audio ducking for your application.

remarks.para: When this property is set to true, if there is background music playing and you have configured this session to allow audio mixing, when your application produces sound, the background music volume is reduced. After you play your sound, you should reset the value to false.
By default, this property is set to false, and no audio ducking takes place.
If there is an error reading or setting the property, this will raise an .

MemberSignature.Value: public static AudioToolbox.AudioSessionCategory Category { get; set; }
member this.Category : AudioToolbox.AudioSessionCategory with get, set

Docs.summary: Controls how the operating system treats the audio from your application.

remarks.para: This property is used to control how the operating system treat your audio. It can be used to control whether your application needs exclusive access to the microphones or speakers or to configure if the audio can be mixed with background music.
If there is an error reading or setting the property, this will raise an .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig void Initialize() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes the Audio Session.

remarks.para: In addition to calling the Initialize method on AudioSession, you will want to set the and the properties to control the priority of your audio and the rules for mixing your audio with other audio playing on the device.
When you call this variation of Initialize, both the and events are raised on the main loop. Use the if you want to specify a different runloop.
If there is an error initializing the AudioSession, this will raise an .

MemberSignature.Value: public static void Initialize (CoreFoundation.CFRunLoop runLoop, string runMode);
.method public static hidebysig void Initialize(class CoreFoundation.CFRunLoop runLoop, string runMode) cil managed
static member Initialize : CoreFoundation.CFRunLoop * string -> unit

Docs.param: Run loop mode (see T:Foundation.CFRunLoop for the various modes).
Docs.summary: Initializes the Audio Session.

remarks.para: In addition to calling the Initialize method on AudioSession, you will want to set the and the properties to control the priority of your audio and the rules for mixing your audio with other audio playing on the device.

When you call this variation of Initialize, both the and events are raised on the specified run loop with the specified run loop mode. Use the if you want those events to be raised on the main thread.

Docs.summary: Determines whether input gain is available.
Docs.remarks: If available, you can use the InputGainScalar property.

Docs.summary: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: public static float InputGainScalar { get; set; }
member this.InputGainScalar : single with get, set

Docs.summary: Input gain as a floating point value from 0 to 1.

remarks.para: Zero represents the minimal input gain value, and one the highest input gain value.
Values outside of the [0, 1] range are clamped.

Docs.summary: To be added.
Controls the source for audio input.
Audio input sources available from a USB connection.

remarks.para: If there are no inputs, the array can be empty.
If there is an error reading or setting the property, this will raise an .

Docs.summary: To be added.
Event raised when the audio session has been interrupted.

remarks.para: You can use the property to determine the cause of the interruption.
In addition, the Resumed event is raised when the audio session is resumed.

Docs.summary: The type of interruption, used to determine the appropriate course of action when the AudioSession is interrupted.
Docs.remarks: The value of this property is only valid when called from the event handler.

MemberSignature.Value: public static AudioToolbox.AudioSessionMode Mode { get; set; }
member this.Mode : AudioToolbox.AudioSessionMode with get, set

Docs.summary: Configuration modes for Audio, it provides finer control over the Category property.

remarks.para: This property is used to do the fine-level control over the audio session. The major component is determined by the property and this is used to tune whether the session behaves in the default mode (what every app got in the pre iOS 5.0 days), Voice Chat, Video Recording or is being used in Measurement mode (where you get raw data, without any gain changes for Audio).

Docs.summary: Whether another application is currently playing back audio.

Docs.summary: Mixes the background audio with the audio generated by the application, regardless of the default setting.

remarks.para: This setting can be used when the session is set to either MediaPlayback or PlayAndRecord.
If there is an error reading or setting the property, this will raise an .

MemberSignature.Value: public static void RemoveListener (AudioToolbox.AudioSessionProperty property, AudioToolbox.AudioSession.PropertyListener listener);
.method public static hidebysig void RemoveListener(valuetype AudioToolbox.AudioSessionProperty property, class AudioToolbox.AudioSession/PropertyListener listener) cil managed

Docs.param: The Callback that was specified in the call to AddListener.
Docs.summary: Removes the specified listener from the list of monitored audio session properties.
Docs.remarks: Properties to monitor are registered with the AddListener method.

Docs.summary: Event raised when the audio session has resumed.
Docs.remarks: In addition, the Interrupted event is raised when the audio session is interrupted.

Docs.summary: Controls the output route, overriding the default set by the .

remarks.para: This property is only valid if the Category is set to PlayAndRecord.
If this property is set to Speaker when a headset is plugged, this will also switch the input to use the system microphone, and not the one on the headset.
The setting of this variable is reset when a headset are plugged or unplugged.
If there is an error reading or setting the property, this will raise an .

Docs.summary: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig void SetActive(bool active) cil managed

Docs.param: Whether to enable the audio session.
Docs.summary: Enables or Disables the audio session.

remarks.para: This method is used to enable and disable the audio session.
This method can throw an AudioSessionException if another application is currently using the AudioSession in the foreground and does not support audio mixing.

MemberSignature.Value: public static AudioToolbox.AudioSessionErrors SetActive (bool active, AudioToolbox.AudioSessionActiveFlags flags);
.method public static hidebysig valuetype AudioToolbox.AudioSessionErrors SetActive(bool active, valuetype AudioToolbox.AudioSessionActiveFlags flags) cil managed
static member SetActive : bool * AudioToolbox.AudioSessionActiveFlags -> AudioToolbox.AudioSessionErrors

Docs.param: True if you want to activate your audio session, false to disable it.
Optional flags used to notify other applications of the change, it can be used to allow other applications to resume playback.
Docs.summary: Activates or deactivates the audio session.
